column4: Ubuntu will always need to install the mp3-plugin after an install, since it cant be in the main distribution. Its not legal to ship it, as I recall.  But you can still play ogg music and other free formats.
thanks...I did try the sound with a sample .ogg file...so that wouldn't be an issue then
karaflux: You need to change the keyboard mapping to you language I think
well, it should play ogg after an install without needing to install anything. For mp3s do as LinuxJones says.
